body:
Comment 2 by **renich@woralelandia.com**: 
I'd like to reopen this one.

There are other issues. For example, web.go uses things in $GOROOT/src/ like:

$GOROOT/src/Make.inc
$GOROOT/src/Make.pkg
etc...

IMHO and according to FHS:

The src dir should be in /usr/share/go or /usr/src/go maybe.
The libs should be at /usr/lib64/go
The docs and examples in /usr/share/doc/go

So, as far as I can see, I need a $GOSRC and, possibly, a $GODOCS vars.

I'm, currently (as you know), trying to package go for Fedora:
http://renich.fedorapeople.org/SPECS/go.spec
